comment: Accounting itself is challenging and fast-paced, but Prof. Dong takes time to go over every concept that trips students up. There's per-chapter homework, which DOES HELP! 4 exams + final, 1 exam is dropped, and the exam review is HEAVILY inspired from the exam. Great choice for Acct for sure.

Her class is points based and is relatively easy to get an A in. Her lectures are great and as long as you do the homework you will do well on the tests. There is also extra credit opportunities with each chapter and before every exam. Also the review from May 4th, 2024 sums up the class pretty well.

As my first introduction to accounting, this was a great class. Honestly, the comprehensive reviews taught me everything. As someone who's not good with this stuff, studying the reviews made this class easy. I recommend.

She's overall a good teacher. She does go fast in class, but that's only because there's so much to cover in little time. For the tests, PLEASE do the comprehensive reviews because they are so similar to the tests. This is literally how I was able to understand and pass with an A in accounting! Take this professor!! She also offers extra credit!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: I took this class in the fall (last semester) and I think that she was a great professor. She speaks in a monotone way but is very knowledgeable about the subject so it's interesting. Lectures are going over notes that she previously provides.  The test reviews are basically on the test. 4 tests, 1 dropped and a final. Look at May 4th review!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: I took the class as a summer 4 week session. Lots of studying outside of class, but provides lots of extra study materials and practice problems. Tons of extra credit opportunities. Provides notes, quiz practice, and examples + answers during class. If you do the video overviews before class for each chapter, you'll do fine. Graded by point system.
Her class is designed for you to get a good grade. As long as you do all the homework and study the comprehensive reviews, you will get an A.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: You have 4 tests and a final. She drops your lowest test score. PLEASE do the comprehensive reviews. They are the same questions on the tests but with different numbers. There's an excel project that takes a couple hours but she gives you like 2 months. There's a one page writing assignment that is SO easy. There's a lot of extra credit as well.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: This a tough course, so prepare yourself. Her lectures are like reviewing a study guide not like lecture slides. So take good notes. You will have an essay to do based on 25% of grade so do it early. Her tests are in online BUT lockdown. Quizizz are online open note 10% of grade. She a fast pace prof. so if you are a slow learner, don't take her.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Her class is tough because of the pace, but the textbook is helpful and her lectures are great. Good notes are a must and if you put effort in, you'll be fine. She's willing to help as long as you ask. Highly recommend this queen.

The instructor started and ended the lesson timely.  She skipped a unit in which we were expected to learn everything on our own, and she covered a different unit in class. Both a written assignment and an Excel project are required.

TAKE HER. She is a great professor. Accounting is a really hard class but as long as you pay attention to her lectures you will get a good grade. Your NEED to show up for class though. As long as you pay attention you will be fine. She also has practice exams that are the exact same as the exam. Lowest exam is dropped.

She's clear about requirements and grading policies. The class is only difficult because it's fast-paced, but the textbook is easy to understand and helpful. I highly recommend her! Her lectures are very helpful and sometimes I got away with not using the textbook for some chapters. She goes over things if needed. I'd take a class with her again!

Accounting is a steep learning curve. ATTEND class no matter what. She is great at demonstrating examples and going through the material. While the course is hard, youtube videos on intro accounting helped me immensely. DO the homework and the comprehension reviews!! The exams are replicas of the comprehensions, if you work through it, you'll pass.

I took a 4-week class with her for 4 days a week, for 2.45 hours. She started class on time, we got out on time. She goes over practice questions and the tests are identical to the study guide. If you study it, you will pass. She isn't a mean teacher, she was accessible outside of class. I failed ACCT2101 last semester and am doing much better!

Make sure computer is compatible with Proctorio, iPads don't work not lenient if it doesn't work (try edge and chrome).LOTS of work. There's a unit you have to teach yourself and write a paper for while she teaches a different unit in class. Tests match studyguide, good at teaching material and walks through classwork, quiz reviews, and practice.

Accounting is hard, but she makes it way better. It's a lot of work. Her lectures are thorough and she always asks if anyone has questions. 4 exams - lowest one dropped. Cumulative final - mandatory. Quizzes every unit are open note. Lots of extra assignments for bonus. An Excel project - start it early! One paper - very easy if you can write.

There is extra credit however the work load is unreasonably high. She has made us teach ourselves a unit while she is teaching us a different one in class. She has even said we are expected to work on her class for 6 hours a week outside of class (The homework alone can take 6 hours). Not to mention the time needed to study.

Worst teacher I have ever had. 10 hour excel project which she won't even help you on if you get stuck.I don't even think she realizes how much work she gives out a week, she just finds random websites with acc work and assigns it. She even told me to buy a new laptop because my camera didn't work, absolutely 0 regard for her students. DO NOT TAKE

This class definitely wasn't easy but I'm glad I took it with her. She drops your lowest test grade and a few other online assignments. She gives generous curves on the tests and she also offers a ton of extra credit assignments
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Take this class if youre not that good at tests. Doing all the connect assignments and extra credit can get you to a B even if you do bad on every test(including the final) since this class is point based. I failed 2 test and got a low C on one and a B on the last exam and still almost managed to pass the class with a B but I fell short 5 points.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: 4 mid-term exams and a cumulative final make up the majority of your grade. All the questions on the tests come from the reviews so just do those and you'll ace the exams. There's homework due every week but all the answers can be found on chegg and quizlet. Easy class.

She makes the material easier and she's caring. Sometimes lectures can be hard to understand but she does lots of practice problems which is probably the best way to learn the material. Attendance is not mandatory but I would absolutely come to class. If you do, you'll barely ever need the textbook. I had a good experience and I would take again.

This is not a hard class. She gives plenty of opportunities to get great grades, she gives us tons of extra credit and tons of curves. Also, everything is online on quizlet or chegg. word for word. I received a 106 in the class.
Took her for a summer class! Shes wonderful! Gives a bunch of extra credit opportunities! Her lectures are very helpful. 100% would take again!

Textbook is mandatory for weekly hmwk and quizzes. There are 2 exams and 1 final. During lecture, she goes over notes thru bullet points which can be annoying. BUT, she also goes over practice questions before every quiz. The questions are very similar to quiz questions. 1 paper, 1 group project that was super easy, and 1 easy excel project.
She really cares, always trying to ensure you understand the material. Do understand that you will need to study, it is accounting. She also responds to emails fast!
She is always there when you need her. She gives you all the resources you need and the homework helps a lot. Strongly recommend taking her class. Accounting is hard but she makes it easier.

Prof Dong was a lovely woman! Most ppl would say she's annoying because she repeats herself A LOT, but i loved it bc it really helped the material stick. Homework is sometimes impossible but the tests are super easy compared to them. Make sure to attend class because she works out a lot of problem examples which is awesome. Take her!!

Professor Dong helps you understand what a hard class already is. It is tough material, but she wants you to pass. She offers retakes on almost ALL quizzes and tests if you ask, and quizzes are open note. Amazing professor!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: This is a class you cannot cruise through. Professor Qi Dong gives you everything very clear from grading criteria, material, and attendance. She is very easy to reach and is very optimistic if you put effort into the class.

Ms. Qi Dong is very nice and cares for her students. She gave her students a lot of extra credit and opportunities to get more points. As long as you do the homework and the practice questions, you will pass the test easily.

Her class is tough but she offered many opportunities to get extra credit and shes very understanding. Keep up with connect assignments and if youre struggling join a study group for extra assistance. Id take her again
rating_tags: Group projects--Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: The professor is nice but the workload is overwhelming at times and the quizzes and tests are very hard. The HW doesnt prepare you for quizzes/tests. You have to do extra work to really do well in this class.

Doesnt explain things well as she seems to think everyone already knows the information completely. Lectures are jer just running through a word document with short bullet points and she just talks about them in detail so if youre not listening you dont get the information as she doesnt write down the important stuff. Would not recommend.

Had her fall 2019. Honestly her accent/handwriting made her hard to understand sometimes, but she 'd repeat & reexplain things during & after class if needed. There are opportunities for bonus points. If you do all exam wrappers on time you can skip the final & just take your highest test grade for the final. She's understanding of personal issues.

Teacher herself isn't a bad person. I'm assuming she's new to Kennesaw State. Until she gets used to things I would not recommend her. She teaches important concepts after quizzes and graded items. The homework is nothing like the quizzes or tests and she says the numbers aren't important?? Beware. Repeats herself A LOT and scribbles all over board
